job_title: Health Information Technician II in Bayonne, NJ
pros: The staff was wonderful to work with. I was able to put up extra hours often. My supervisor was very accommodating with my school schedule and they were always willing to train and help when needed. Pay was decent for a college student.
cons: This was a weekend job only. Despite being able to pick up extra hours, one was not given an opportunity for much overtime. I often worked alone on the weekends which was boring at times.

review_title: Overall, positive experience, with some hold ups in efforts to make changes -considering financial, staffing, equipment.
pros: Opened to different experience- increased experience in critical care, bariatric, enteral/parenteral nutrition,outpatient.
cons: Limited coverage, trying to make changes for patients and difficult with financial,patient population to consider, diet restrictions/food availability, staffing in kitchen. Staff to staff conflicts and different ideas. Seniority- I don't have any, PTO time goes to them first.

job_title: Technical Support Specialist in Bayonne, NJ
pros: Bayonne is a small community, where everyone knows everyone.  The same can be said of Bayonne Medical Center. it is a very intimate environment, allowing the getting to know everyone in the facility. This can be a good aid in adapting to the culture of the hospital.
cons: I have found that the following motto describes this hospital: " You can always qualify for more responsibility, though, never for more money."

pros: Small hospital great coworkers close to home getting to know patients well to being the only hospital in the community,opportunities for nurse driven change
cons: Top heavy organization ,lower salaries than other hospitals in the area, little ancillary help, business model of a for profit hospital hard to apply to patient care everything is based on productivity instead of acuity

review_title: Small hospital with friendly staff but management is not the best.
pros: Competitive pay and bonuses, union, good medical benefits cost, community focused adult medical treatment, good experience for a new nurse
cons: Equipment age and repair problems, management looking to sell the hospital, no pediatric or obstetric treatment
